thread.title: Parts of Iowa will be in an Ice Storm Warning: Here's what that means
thread.title_full: Parts of Iowa will be in an Ice Storm Warning: Here's what that means

author: Lia Reichmann
title: Parts of Iowa will be in an Ice Storm Warning: Here's what that means
text:
IOWA, USA â€” Some Iowans can expect to see freezing rain while the rest of the state is under a [Winter Weather Advisory](https://www.weareiowa.com/article/weather/forecast/des-moines-iowa-weather-forecast-radar-local-5-woi/524-12bac3fc-4af5-443f-bbaa-4acdbe5ea11a) from Friday afternoon into Saturday morning.
Roads, particularly bridges and overpasses, will be impacted by a mix of ice, snow and sleet according to the [National Weather Service](https://forecast.weather.gov/showsigwx.php?warnzone=IAZ034&warncounty=IAC025&firewxzone=IAZ034&local_place1=3%20Miles%20SE%20Lohrville%20IA&product1=Winter+Weather+Advisory&lat=42.2279&lon=-94.514) in Des Moines.
People, especially those in southwest Iowa, can expect to see slippery roads and branches and power lines coated in ice and should take precautionary steps to stay safe in these icy conditions. [Wind chill forecasts](https://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=41.588822&lon=-93.620309) will go as low as zero to the mid-teens on Friday before warming up over the weekend.
What is an Ice Storm Warning?
Portions of central and northeast Iowa are under an[ Ice Storm Warning ](https://www.weather.gov/wwamap/wwatxtget.php?cwa=dmx&wwa=ice%20storm%20warning)from 8 p.m. Friday to noon Saturday as the NWS anticipates significant ice. An Ice Storm Warning is issued when predicted freezing rain produces ice accumulation of at least 1/4", according to the NWS.
The warning covers the area from Grinnell up to Waterloo and through Iowa City and Cedar Rapids. Residents in this area can expect to see about a 1/4" of ice. The NWS strongly discourages travel as roads will be slick and hazardous and some power outages and tree damage may occur.
RELATED: [Full list of winter weather alerts](https://www.weareiowa.com/weather/alerts)
When will the freezing rain start?
Southwest Iowa can expect the freezing rain starting around 4 p.m. Friday. The western parts of the state will see the storm around 6 p.m., while central and northern Iowa will see it by 7 p.m. The freezing rain is expected to hit eastern Iowa around 10 p.m.
